item.title: Notion takes on AI-notetakers like Granola with its own transcription feature
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meeting transcription space is a hot commodity for all productivity suites. Companies like ClickUp and Zoom have added transcription with an AI summary to take on another upstart in this vertical, including Read AI, Zoom’s assistant, Circleback, Granola, or Otter. The latest entrant in the race to build meeting transcription tools is Notion. The company is rolling out an […]

item.title: Amazon Prime Video in India to get ads starting in June
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Amazon will bring ads to movies and shows on Prime Video in India starting June 17, over a year after introducing ads in markets including the U.S., U.K., Germany, and Canada. On Tuesday, Amazon emailed Prime members in India to announce the rollout of “limited advertisements” on content streaming on Prime Video. Amazon originally announced […]

item.title: At TechCrunch All Stage 2025, Rob Biederman will help founders rethink how to scale
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: If you’re a founder looking to grow your startup, chances are you’re wrestling with more than just product or capital. Talent, scale, and smart execution are the real battlegrounds. That’s exactly what TechCrunch All Stage 2025 is built to address on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station. See top startup leaders taking the stage […]

item.title: GM’s new ‘manganese rich’ battery promises cheaper EVs in 2028
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Lithium-manganese-rich (LMR) batteries should slash costs without sacrificing much range.

item.title: Apple announces new accessibility features, including future support for brain implants
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Apple on Tuesday announced a range of accessibility features coming to its devices later this year. New Accessibility Nutrition Labels will provide more detailed information for apps and games on the App Store, while a new Braille Access tool will turn the iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Vision Pro into a braille note taker. Additional […]

item.title: Spotify’s AI DJ now let you use voice commands to personalize your tunes
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: In a bid to make its AI DJ feel more interactive, Spotify is updating the feature to allow users to request music or change the mood of a playlist using voice commands. The company is rolling out this feature, initially only supported in English, in over 60 markets for its Premium subscribers. Previously, users could […]

item.title: Insurtech Bestow lands $120M Series D from Goldman Sachs, Smith Point Capital
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description: Melbourne O’Banion co-founded insurtech Bestow with Jonathan Abelmann in 2017 after struggling to secure his own life insurance policy. His goal was to make it easier for people to obtain life insurance and make the process more tech-enabled. Initially, Bestow operated as a direct-to-consumer insurance provider — selling, underwriting, and servicing life insurance policies. In […]

item.title: Robinhood grows its footprint in Canada by acquiring WonderFi
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Robinhood revealed Tuesday that it’s acquiring Canadian crypto leader WonderFi for CA$250 million (around $178.56 million) in an all-cash deal as it pushes into Canada’s growing digital asset market. WonderFi operates two regulated crypto platforms, Bitbuy and Coinsquare, with over CA$2.1 billion in assets under custody. The transaction offers WonderFi shareholders CA$0.36 per share, representing […]

item.title: Marks & Spencer confirms customers’ personal data was stolen in hack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: A ransomware gang reportedly took credit for the data breach.

item.title: Realta Fusion taps $36M in fresh funds for its fusion-in-a-bottle reactor
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Realta hopes to build power plants cheaply enough to supply power as low as $40 per megawatt-hour.

item.title: Meta to start selling its Ray-Ban smart glasses in India on May 19
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The smart glasses are available for pre-order on Ray-Ban's site, and will retail for ₹29,990 at Ray-Ban stores at launch.

item.title: Anthropic co-founder Jared Kaplan is coming to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Hungry to learn more about Anthropic, directly from Anthropic? You aren’t alone if so, which is why we’re so delighted to announce that Anthropic co-founder and Chief Science Officer Jared Kaplan is joining the main stage at TechCrunch Sessions: AI on June 5 at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall. And TechCrunch Sessions: AI is right around […]

item.title: Improvements in ‘reasoning’ AI models may slow down soon, analysis finds
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: An analysis by Epoch AI, a nonprofit AI research institute, suggests the AI industry may not be able to eke massive performance gains out of reasoning AI models for much longer. As soon as within a year, progress from reasoning models could slow down, according to the report’s findings. Reasoning models such as OpenAI’s o3 […]

item.title: AllTrails debuts $80/year membership that includes AI-powered smart routes
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: AllTrails, the hiking and biking companion that was named 2023’s iPhone App of the Year, is launching a new premium membership called “Peak” that includes an upgraded feature set. This $80-per-year subscription will introduce AI tools to build custom routes and provide real-time trail condition forecasts, trail traffic heatmaps, and a feature that lets you […]

item.title: Microsoft Build 2025: What to expect, from Azure to Copilot upgrades
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak, Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Microsoft is hosting its annual Build developer conference next week from May 19 to 22. The event is guaranteed to include announcements regarding new AI integrations, services, and apps, including for Windows. At last year’s Build, Microsoft announced an integration of Copilot into Microsoft Teams, Copilot+ AI-powered PCs, Windows Volumetric Apps for Meta Quest headsets, […]

item.title: Tesla’s robotaxi plans have the attention of federal investigators
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Federal safety investigators have sent Tesla a detailed list of questions on its upcoming robotaxi service as part of an investigation into how the company’s “Full Self-Driving (Supervised)” software operates in low-visibility conditions. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration’s Office of Defects Investigation wants the additional information about Full Self-Driving (Supervised) — or “FSD” — […]

item.title: Slate Auto crosses 100,000 refundable reservations in two weeks
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Buzzy new EV startup Slate Auto has racked up more than 100,000 reservations for its customizable low-cost electric pickup truck, the company has confirmed to TechCrunch. Slate crossed the milestone over the weekend, just a little more than two weeks after coming out of stealth mode and unveiling the truck at an event in Los […]

item.title: Google I/O 2025: How to watch all the AI and Android reveals
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Google is gearing up to hold its largest developer conference of the year, Google I/O 2025, on May 20 and May 21. CEO Sundar Pichai, DeepMind CEO and co-founder Demis Hassabis, and executives in charge of Search, Cloud, and Android will announce major updates to Google’s product offerings. We’re expecting Google I/O 2025 to focus […]

item.title: Apple brings satellite features to iPhone 13 with iOS 18.5
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple on Monday released iOS 18.5, which expands emergency satellite capabilities to iPhone 13 owners for the first time. Previously, the satellite features were available to those running an iPhone 14 or later. The emergency satellite system for iPhone is designed to be used at critical times when a cellular signal or Wi-Fi is not […]

item.title: Even a16z VCs say no one really knows what an AI agent is
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Buzzwords that are stretched to the point of being meaningless are as old as the tech industry itself. The top current one is “AI agent” and its variants, like “agentic.” So, unsurprisingly, no one really knows what an AI agent is. Even people with software engineering backgrounds who work for Andreessen Horowitz, one of the premier venture […]
